formattedAddress: 416 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 416 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036-6809, USA

editorialSummary.text: Off Broadway theater producing works by contemporary American writers, composers & lyricists.

originalText.text: Main stage is sized just right- about 200 seats. Almost every production is first rate.

text.text: Main stage is sized just right- about 200 seats. Almost every production is first rate.

originalText.text: It’s an extremely small theater. So if something happens to a cast or crew member, your show will be canceled. Like mine was 5 minutes before curtain. And if you flew to NYC just to see this show, you will be out $1000 in flight/hotel and out of luck. So be careful, you can get burned by the small theater. I’ve been told by many people this was their favorite show of the year and I was so excited to see it. But now I’ll probably never know because I don’t live in New York and I don’t know when I’ll have the money to go back.

originalText.text: The location of the bar is convenient, it is next to the Yellow MTA subway station 49th street. The outdoor dining area is crowded, but there is a singer singing there, which makes the atmosphere grand.  There are 2 floors in the bar, and there is a bar area and catering area. I visited the bar area. The finger food are nice, and the price is reasonable at that area. The bar area usually has 2-3 groups of people gathering.

text.text: The location of the bar is convenient, it is next to the Yellow MTA subway station 49th street. The outdoor dining area is crowded, but there is a singer singing there, which makes the atmosphere grand.  There are 2 floors in the bar, and there is a bar area and catering area. I visited the bar area. The finger food are nice, and the price is reasonable at that area. The bar area usually has 2-3 groups of people gathering.

originalText.text:
I accidentally came into this theater looking for the nondescript one next door, the first time. I was a little disappointed I was in the wrong place. Playwrights Horizons is exactly what I expect a modern theater to look like.

I didn't take pictures of the lobby, silly me, but it's quite nice. The second floor is a half floor so you're basically in a cathedral of a theater. There's concessions center rear and seating along the left.
The restrooms are downstairs and just how I like them. Like the ones in the airport where you don't have to touch a door on your way out.
There's a freight sized elevator so it's ADA accessible.

I was seated in Row E Seat 5. From the seating chart you can see that I will be extremely biased about the leg room. God bless Row E! I didn't even need to get up for the Intermission!
The seats are nicely padded and roomy.

The sound was very good. The "I'm not sure if the actors are miked or not" good.
The staging was well done though the foreshortening may have made the stage look smaller than it is. I'd need to see a different production in order to tell.
Right now "Indian Summer" is playing. I'd be remiss if I didn't write a review of it. It was very funny, yet with a melancholy ending. Good stuff.

I really hope I'm able to see another play here in the future. It's a lovely space.

I was seated in Row E Seat 5. From the seating chart you can see that I will be extremely biased about the leg room. God bless Row E! I didn't even need to get up for the Intermission!

I really hope I'm able to see another play here in the future. It's a lovely space.

originalText.text: I’ve seen 3 shows here, going to see my 4th soon. Always a wonderful experience!
